definition[0]: steady and not likely to move or change
example[0]: A wide base will make the structure much more stable.
example[2]: He is said to be in a stable condition in hospital.
definition[1]: calm, reasonable, and not easy to upset
example[3]: He was clearly not a very stable person.
definition[2]: a stable substance tends to stay in the same chemical or atomic state
definition[3]: a building where horses are kept
definition[4]: a group of racing horses that has one owner or trainer
definition[5]: a group of people working for the same company or with the same trainer

definition[6]: to put or keep a horse in a stable
